text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
author: Walter Bagehot

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Unknown

text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The meaning of life is to give life meaning.
author: Ken Hudgins

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

text: Life is not about waiting for the storm to pass but learning to dance in the rain.
author: Vivian Greene

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Life is a journey, not a race.
author: Unknown

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: The only thing you take with you when you’re gone is what you leave behind.
author: Unknown

text: Do not judge my story by the chapter you walked in on.
author: Unknown

text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

text: Life is too short to waste time hating anyone.
author: Unknown

text: The best revenge is to live well.
author: Unknown

text: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don’t resist them; that only creates sorrow.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The hardest thing in life is to know which bridge to cross and which to burn.
author: David Russell

text: Life is not about how fast you run or how high you climb, but how well you bounce.
author: Vivian Komori

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Life’s most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The only way to avoid criticism is to do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
author: Aristotle

text: Life is a balance of holding on and letting go.
author: Rumi

text: The secret of life is to have no fear.
author: Fela Kuti

text: You don’t have to be rich to sparkle.
author: Unknown

text: Life is like a Wi-Fi signal—just when you think you’re connected, it drops.
author: Unknown

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Life is not about waiting for the right moment; it’s about making the moment right.
author: Unknown

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a book and there are a thousand pages I have not yet read.
author: Cassandra Clare

text: The greatest gift you can give someone is your time, because when you give your time, you’re giving a portion of your life you can’t get back.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty: not knowing what comes next.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

text: Life is a mystery to be lived, not a problem to be solved.
author: Adrienne Rich

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Life is about making an impact, not making an income.
author: Kevin Kruse

text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is a canvas; throw all the paint you can at it.
author: Danny Kaye

text: The greatest risk in life is not taking one.
author: Unknown

text: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Life is a daring adventure or it is nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: The only way to live a remarkable life is to take remarkable risks.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not about how many times you fall, but how many times you get back up.
author: Unknown

text: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure much.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Life is a song—sing it. Life is a game—play it.
author: Sai Baba

text: The only constant in life is change.
author: Heraclitus

text: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
author: Ernest Holmes

text: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Life is not about finding shelter from the storm, but about learning to dance in the rain.
author: Unknown

text: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
author: Danny Kaye

text: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle.
author: Tara Brach

text: Life is a balance between holding on and letting go.
author: Unknown

text: The greatest lessons in life are learned from our failures.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not about waiting for the perfect moment, but making every moment perfect.
author: Unknown

text: The only way to grow is to step outside your comfort zone.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a journey to be experienced, not a problem to be solved.
author: Winnie the Pooh

text: The only thing you can control is how you respond to the things you can’t control.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not about what you achieve, but who you become in the process.
author: Unknown

text: The beauty of life lies in its imperfections.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a series of moments, and each one is a new beginning.
author: Unknown

text: The only way to find peace is to embrace the chaos of life.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The only way to truly know life is to live it fully.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a puzzle; every piece fits if you find the right place for it.
author: Unknown

text: The only thing that makes life worth living is love.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a story, and you are the author.
author: Unknown

text: The only way to live a meaningful life is to live it with purpose.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not about how much you have, but how much you enjoy.
author: Unknown

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Life is a dance, and you must learn the steps as you go.
author: Unknown

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don’t compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The Tao that can be told is not the eternal Tao.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows does not speak. He who speaks does not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The softest things in the world overcome the hardest things in the world.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Those who know do not say; those who say do not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Act without expectation.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The greatest virtue is to follow the Tao and the Tao alone.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To attain knowledge, add things every day. To attain wisdom, remove things every day.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The Tao is hidden, and has no name; but it is the Tao which is skillful at imparting to all things what they need.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The more laws and restrictions there are, the poorer people become.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who is contented is rich.
author: Lao Tzu

text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When the work is done, and one’s name is becoming distinguished, to withdraw into obscurity is the way of Heaven.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The soft overcomes the hard; the gentle overcomes the rigid.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To lead people, walk behind them.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The wise man is one who knows what he does not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When there is no desire, all things are at peace.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The world is won by those who let it go.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend.
author: Lao Tzu

text: By letting go, it all gets done.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The Tao is like a bellows: it is empty yet infinitely capable.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The more you know, the less you understand.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Manifest plainness, embrace simplicity, reduce selfishness, have few desires.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The way to do is to be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you are at one with the Tao, the Tao welcomes you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The great acts are made up of small deeds.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If you want to awaken all of humanity, then awaken all of yourself.
author: Lao Tzu
